item.title: Too Like the Lightning
item.description: Of course I’m immediately starting all over again after [[books/perhaps the stars|Perhaps The Stars]]. Every time, tingling chills down my spine on page 254:

item.title: Seven Surrenders
item.description: There’s no way I can talk comprehensively about this series, so for now I’m just going to keep a running list of different things I notice each time I read them.

item.title: The Will to Battle
item.description: Reader, I cried like Mycroft Canner. It’s very much the first half of a whole (third quarter of four?), and it needs [[books/perhaps the stars|the last book]] to be complete, but what a feat it is on its own.

item.title: Perhaps the Stars
item.description: I still haven’t found the words to talk about this one. Maybe next year I will. It should be in the Smithsonian, or win the Nobel prize, or something, as one of humanity’s greatest achievements.

item.title: Clear and Muddy Loss of Love
item.description: This is just what I was in the mood for, a 300+ chapter, 6000+ page sapphic slow burn court intrigue. The prose (and/or translation?
